levelledPara.title: Fuel System Overview
levelledPara.para: The fuel system stores, manages, and delivers fuel to the engines under all operating conditions. The system ensures continuous fuel supply, proper weight distribution, and safe fuel handling throughout the flight envelope.

levelledPara.title: Fuel Storage
levelledPara.para: The aircraft fuel is stored in multiple tanks to optimize center of gravity (CG) management and provide adequate range:

listItem.para: Center Tank - Main fuselage fuel storage (ATA 28-11)
Wing Tanks (Left/Right) - Integral wing fuel storage (ATA 28-12)
Auxiliary Tank - Extended range storage (optional) (ATA 28-13)

levelledPara.para: All tanks incorporate vent systems, drains, and access provisions for inspection and maintenance.

levelledPara.title: Fuel Distribution

listItem.para: Boost Pumps - Provide positive fuel pressure (ATA 28-21)
Transfer Pumps - Move fuel between tanks (ATA 28-21)
Fuel Lines - Transport fuel throughout aircraft (ATA 28-22)
Crossfeed System - Enables fuel sharing between wings (ATA 28-23)
Fuel Valves - Control fuel flow (ATA 28-24)

levelledPara.para: The system provides redundant fuel paths to ensure continued operation with single pump failures.

levelledPara.title: Fuel Indication
levelledPara.para: The fuel quantity indication system (ATA 28-41) provides accurate fuel quantity information to the flight crew:

listItem.para: Capacitance-type fuel quantity probes in each tank
Digital processing with temperature compensation
Individual tank quantity displays
Total fuel quantity and fuel used calculations
Low fuel level warnings

levelledPara.title: Fuel Temperature Monitoring
levelledPara.para: The fuel temperature monitoring system (ATA 28-42) provides:

listItem.para: Temperature sensors in each tank
Low fuel temperature warnings
Fuel icing prevention monitoring

levelledPara.title: Safety Features
levelledPara.para: The fuel system incorporates extensive safety features:

listItem.para: Redundant boost pumps for engine feed reliability (DAL A)
Leak detection system with crew alerts
Fuel filter with bypass indication
Water drain provisions and contamination detection
Fuel tank isolation valves for emergency shutoff
Fuel imbalance monitoring and automatic correction
Lightning protection and static discharge provisions

levelledPara.title: Alternative Fuel Compatibility
levelledPara.para: The fuel system is designed for compatibility with:

listItem.para: Jet-A and Jet-A1 conventional fuels
Sustainable Aviation Fuels (SAF) up to 100% blend
Future hydrogen (H2) systems with appropriate modifications

warningAndCaution.para: Hydrogen fuel systems require special handling procedures due to extreme flammability and cryogenic temperatures. Only trained personnel with appropriate equipment may service H2 systems.
